message: running epio upload_ssh_key (from the command line) fails with a traceback "WindowsError: [Error 2]  The system cannot find the file specified" I've read thru upload_ssh_key.py and it seems the problem is the absence of ssh-keygen. can anyone point me in the right direction? (what alternatives exist for ssh-keygen, etc)
you can upload your keys through the web interface though

you need to install cygwin (cygwin.org) to get ssh-keygen; you can also generate keys with puttygen: http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html but the ep.io script won't know how to use it
you can just use PuTTY to SSH into our server to run commands, directly, too - just see how we do it in epio/commands/run_command.py
the epio client is just recommended, not required :)
Also bear in mind you can just push with git or hg directly: http://www.ep.io/docs/vcss/
and the other functions of the client are available through the web interface
I think I'll go with the hg option, thank you.
